definitions.definition: move or cause to move so as to cover an opening.
examples: she jumped into the train just as the doors were closing
glass doors close off the living room from the hall

definitions.definition: bring two parts of (something) together so as to block its opening or bring it into a folded state.
gradually get nearer to someone or something.
examples: they plotted a large group of aircraft about 130 miles away and closing fast
synonyms: gain on someone More"the enemy was closing fast"narrow

definitions.definition: come into contact with (something) so as to encircle and hold it.
examples: my fist closed around the weapon
synonyms: connect; form a circle "his arms closed around her"

examples: this will cause a relay to operate and close the circuit

definitions.definition: bring or come to an end.
examples: the members were thanked for attending, and the meeting was closed

definitions.definition: (of a business, organization, or institution) cease to be in operation or accessible to the public, either permanently or at the end of a working day or other period of time.
examples: the factory is to close with the loss of 150 jobs
synonyms: go bust "the factory is to close"

examples: we close with a point about truth

definitions.definition: bring (a business transaction) to a satisfactory conclusion.
examples: he closed a deal with a metal dealer
synonyms: finalize; informalwrap up "he closed a deal"

definitions.definition: remove all the funds from (a bank account) and cease to use it.
make (a data file) inaccessible after use, so that it is securely stored until required again.
